Portrait Chinois / Universea is a one-page website created and fully illustrated by myself as part of the Web Integration module in my first year of DUT MMI at Champs. This website could be considered as an interactive 'poetic' CV that allows visitors (especially recruiters) to discover me in a more original, in-depth, and visual way.

intro_title.text: hello, I'm Thi Van An TRUONG, creative front-end developer.

short_text.text: Rationality, creativity, and attention to detail are fundamental values of mine.
As a creative developer, I am particularly interested in the beauty both inside and outside of code, in other words, data and user interfaces.
Always striving to progress, I don't shy away from difficulties and challenges but prefer to face them head-on.

In a beautiful love-hate (but mostly love) relationship with the web and immersive experiences, generative and creative coding, I am seeking a full-time position as a Creative Front-end Web Developer.

description.text: I got apprenticeship contracts in Bachelor and Master at Gobelins, then a fixed-term contract within the tech team of the AKQA agency, 75006 Paris.

As a junior web developer, I participated in the development of mobile applications in React Native, and then websites with React/Vue in the front-end and Headless CMS in the back-end. To name a few projects to which I contributed : the current mobile application of SEPHORA France, the complete make over of APRIL.FR, the AKQA 2023 Wishcard project.
Dashboard Interface for WAVE (Water Analysis for Vietnamese Ecosystem) project's data output.
"Sneak into the crew. Find your rivals and eliminate them to become captain. Beware, they're after you too. Will you be discreet enough? Let the silent mutiny begin!"
Graduation Project of my Master Design and Management of Interactive Innovation (Expert in Interactive Digital Creation), option Lead Technician (2020-2022).

"The Christmas trees are already decorated, the advent calendars are well underway, and the cookies are waiting on the table...In short, it's Christmas Eve! But what a disaster, Santa Claus has caught a terrible cold! He is no longer able to deliver all the presents.

To replace him on his famous tour, you, the elf Tamarre, have been chosen to take the reins! Your mission: to distribute the multitude of gifts. But be careful, it would be a shame to disturb the serenity of Christmas Eve. So, good luck!"

This website could be considered as an interactive 'poetic' CV that allows visitors (especially recruiters) to discover me in a more original, in-depth, and visual way.

"Between stereotypes, pressure to be thin or masculine, how to sell a product without perpetuating sexist clich√©s? In 'Don't play that gender card', you will have all the tools to confront the issues of gendered marketing in our supermarkets...be careful of the potential negative publicity!"
First year of Master, end of the year project.
As part of the end-of-year project in Bachelor's degree at Gobelins, we went from Connected Mobility, to raising awareness about Personal Data Protection.

"Ex Nihilo is a face-to-face encounter between the user and their personal data in the form of a mobile investigation game. Find a missing person by inspecting their phone and discover what happened to them.
What secrets could you uncover?
And what if the answer to your questions was somewhere else?"
An immersive 2D story created as part of the 2019 Louvre Workshop in Bachelor's degree at Gobelins:

"The goddess of the wild nature, Artemis, finds herself imprisoned in the paintings of a pottery created by the artist Nicosthenes. The goddess feels a sense of helplessness that transforms into a desire for escape, proclaiming female emancipation in an ancient and mythological universe. With small objects, we can create great stories."
